issue.title: DAZN Dynamic Ad Insertion
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard DNS ### AdGuard version Default DoH ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? dazn.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I am mainly concerned about the Adguard public DNS viability of blocking the domain dai.google.com DAZN sports streaming service uses dynamic ad insertion in their broadcasts, therefore inserting personalized ads, not only on web browsers, but also on Smart TV devices where the only way to block ads would be using DNS blocking. During commercial breaks, requests to the domain in question can be evidenced. Manually blocking requests to said domain does not break the video stream, it only makes it so ad breaks do not have personalized ads. Therefore adding this domain to the blocklist would allow users of DAZN service to enjoy their streams without personalized ads inserted during breaks, and instead allow us to watch the original broadcast ads. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
It's an online shop and this reported element contains links to other products (from the same website).
It's displayed only when current product is not available, so I think that it should not be blocked.
Fixed.

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard DNS ### AdGuard version Default DoH ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? dazn.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I am mainly concerned about the Adguard public DNS viability of blocking the domain dai.google.com DAZN sports streaming service uses dynamic ad insertion in their broadcasts, therefore inserting personalized ads, not only on web browsers, but also on Smart TV devices where the only way to block ads would be using DNS blocking. During commercial breaks, requests to the domain in question can be evidenced. Manually blocking requests to said domain does not break the video stream, it only makes it so ad breaks do not have personalized ads. Therefore adding this domain to the blocklist would allow users of DAZN service to enjoy their streams without personalized ads inserted during breaks, and instead allow us to watch the original broadcast ads. 2. Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://app.getresponse.com/click.html?x=a62b&co=hhvG0Y&lc=zXez7B&mc=JM&s=BQSqiMC&u=QX16N&z=EBIMhTH](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.getresponse.com%2Fclick.html%3Fx%3Da62b%26co%3DhhvG0Y%26lc%3DzXez7B%26mc%3DJM%26s%3DBQSqiMC%26u%3DQX16N%26z%3DEBIMhTH) ### Comment > GetResponse links does not work with AdGuard. > When opening GetResponse link from email newsletter webpage does not load. This happens due to redirect to `an.gr-wcon.com` domain which gets filtered on AdGuard DSN level. > This domain was recently added to filter as part of this issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214417 > > This behaviour seems unexpected outcome of the above change and prevents users from opening newsletter links (maybe too aggressive rule?). > > Is there any particular reason to globally filter `an.gr-wcon.com`. > Is there something newsletter creator or get response could do to solve potential issue with this domain? ``` Username: @TomaszLizer ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bgweuqgu600goccw0ookcw8s4gcsck88yfcdat94vs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/k2e2sqmgyhsgc0080ggc4csw88ocskwibpp7o5emoo.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5svm2mjdcgg8ggc404g004s040s0sg0jsxeg3qruhs.png?nc=1)

comment.body: @zloyden This is a link for the book of this very comic, I don't think it should be hidden. It seems the issue is that `sai-zen-sen.jp##article[id^="comic-"] > footer:has(a[href="https://twitter.com/twi_yon"])`, added for https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/209893#issuecomment-3106855423, hides that too only at the initial load.

This happens due to redirect to `an.gr-wcon.com` domain which gets filtered on AdGuard DSN level. > This domain was recently added to filter as part of this issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214417 > > This behaviour seems unexpected outcome of the above change and prevents users from opening newsletter links (maybe too aggressive rule?). > > Is there any particular reason to globally filter `an.gr-wcon.com`. > Is there something newsletter creator or get response could do to solve potential issue with this domain? ``` Username: @TomaszLizer ``` ### Screenshots

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://app.getresponse.com/click.html?x=a62b&co=hhvG0Y&lc=zXez7B&mc=JM&s=BQSqiMC&u=QX16N&z=EBIMhTH](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.getresponse.com%2Fclick.html%3Fx%3Da62b%26co%3DhhvG0Y%26lc%3DzXez7B%26mc%3DJM%26s%3DBQSqiMC%26u%3DQX16N%26z%3DEBIMhTH) ### Comment > GetResponse links does not work with AdGuard. > When opening GetResponse link from email newsletter webpage does not load. This happens due to redirect to `an.gr-wcon.com` domain which gets filtered on AdGuard DSN level. > This domain was recently added to filter as part of this issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214417 > > This behaviour seems unexpected outcome of the above change and prevents users from opening newsletter links (maybe too aggressive rule?). > > Is there any particular reason to globally filter `an.gr-wcon.com`. > Is there something newsletter creator or get response could do to solve potential issue with this domain? ``` Username: @TomaszLizer ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bgweuqgu600goccw0ookcw8s4gcsck88yfcdat94vs.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/k2e2sqmgyhsgc0080ggc4csw88ocskwibpp7o5emoo.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5svm2mjdcgg8ggc404g004s040s0sg0jsxeg3qruhs.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | AdGuard Home DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server System version: | `Proxmox VE 9.0.3` Browser: | Safari Blocklists: | General:
AdGuard DNS
